title.rendered: Lahore vs Peshawar, Eliminator 2, Pakistan T20 League 2023: Fantasy Team, Playing XIs, Pitch Report & Fantasy Tips

content.rendered:
We have opted for a fantasy cricket team based on recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Probable XIs

Lahore: Mirza Tahir Baig, Fakhar Zaman, Abdullah Shafique, Sam Billings (wk), Hussain Talat, Sikandar Raza, David Wiese, Rashid Khan, Shaheen Afridi (c), Haris Rauf, Zaman Khan

Peshawar: Saim Ayub, Babar Azam (c), Haseebullah Khan (wk), Mohammad Harris, Tom Kohler-Cadmore, James Neesham, Aamer Jamal, Azmatullah Omarzai, Wahab Riaz, Mujeeb Ur Rahman, Salman Irshad

Pitch Report

Venue: Gaddafi Stadium, Lahore

(Based on the last three games)

1st innings average score: 180

2nd innings average score: 119

Wickets per innings: 7

Type: Good for batting

Wins

Batting 1st: 100%

Batting 2nd: —

Also Read:

Bangladesh vs Ireland, 1st ODI 2023 Fantasy Tips

Fantasy Tips of The Day

David Wiese’s numbers in qualifiers and eliminators are superb: 480 runs at 28, 24 wickets, and 14 catches.

With 384 runs at a strike rate of 168, Fakhar Zaman is the highest run-scorer for Lahore this season. Against Peshawar at the Gaddafi Stadium, he has hammered two fifties (63 and 96).

Abdullah Shafique averages 41 against Peshawar. At the venue in this edition, he has top scores of 75, 45, and 48.

Zaman Khan has had a good time hunting down Peshawar batters: his strike rate reads 9.8.

Rashid Khan has gone wicketless only once in the last ten matches, overall scalping 18 wickets.

Shaheen Afridi smashed fifty and picked up four wickets when the sides clashed last time.

Babar Azam is the leading run-getter (524 runs at 40) against Lahore, while Wahab Riaz has the most wickets (22) including seven in the last three games.

Saim Ayub has been a popular pick in fantasy leagues of late, scoring big at the top. In his last 10 outings, he has registered five fifties.

Azmatullah Omarzai and James Neesham starred in the Best11 in four of the last five appearances.

In the last three games at the venue, top-order batters scored four fifties, while pacers scalped 70% of the wickets.
